intro: Kutchubaea sericantha, commonly known as the giant kutchubaea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
